column2: 1 Introduction
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent font-larger hanged-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The development of the Chinese word segmen-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tation system presented in this bakeoff began in
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Feb. this year, and will last for one year with the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: support of the ILAB Beijing initial project
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: within France Telecom R&D.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Although the project last only half year by
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: now, the main components of the system has
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: been implemented, including code identification
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and conversion, basic segmentation, factoid de-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen column-bottom

column2: .com.cn
column3: page=0 xpos=6 ypos=2 right-column left-indent right-indent column-top above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: tection, morphological analysis, name entity
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: identification, segmentation standards adaptor,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: except the components of code identification
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and conversion and segmentation standards
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: adaptors, other components are integrated in a
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: statistical framework of n-gram language model.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column centered right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2 System Description
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2.1 Code identification and conversion
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2

column2: For processing both Simplified and Traditional
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: Chinese text from a variety of locales, including
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: Mainland China, Hong Kong and Taiwan, we
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: choose UTF-8 as internal character representa-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion within the system. The ability to transpar-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ently handle Chinese text from any Chinese
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: locale greatly simplifies the logic of the segmen-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tation system.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: 2.2 N-gram language model
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail numbered-heading2

column2: In our system, Chinese words can be categorized
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: into one of the following types: lexicon words,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: morphological words, factoids, name entities.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: These types of words are processed in different
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: ways in our system, and are incorporated into a
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: unified statistical framework of the trigram lan-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: guage model.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: 2.2.1 Basic segmentation
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail numbered-heading3

column2: Each input sentence is first segmented into indi-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: vidual characters. These characters and the char-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: acter strings are then looked up in a lexicon. For
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the efficient search, the lexicon is represented by
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a TRIE compressed in a double-array data struc-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=0 xpos=4 ypos=9 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only page-bottom

column2: ture. Given a character string, all its prefix
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified page-top headchar-lower

column2: strings that form lexicon words can be retrieved
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: efficiently by browsing the TRIE whose root
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: represents its first character.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: 2.2.2 Factoid detection
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail numbered-heading3

column2: There are twenty four kinds of factoid words,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: such as time, date, money, etc. All the factoid
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: words are represented as regular expressions,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: and compiled into a compressed DFA with the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: row-index algorithm.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: 2.2.3 Morphological analysis
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail numbered-heading3

column2: As (Wu 2003) discussed in the paper, it is those
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail year headchar-capital

column2: morphologically derived words (MDWs hereaf-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ter) that are most controversial and most likely
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to be treated differently in different standards
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and different systems. In our system, there are
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: six main categories of morphological processes,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: affixation, directional verb, resultative verb,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: splitting verb, reduplication and merging, and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: we employ a chart parsing algorithm augmented
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with word lattices structure which incorporates
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the morphological rules especially designed for
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Chinese languages with restrictive CFG.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: 2.2.4 Name entity identification
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail numbered-heading3

column2: Our NE identification concentrates on three
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: types of NEs, namely, personal names (PERs),
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: location names (LOCs) and organization names
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: (ORGs). For Chinese person names, we only
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: consider PN candidates that begin with a family
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: name stored in the family name list and follow a
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: given name which is of one or two characters
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: long. For transliterations of foreign person
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: names, a PN candidate would be generated if it
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: contains only characters stored in a transliterated
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: character list. For location names and organiza-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tions names, we only use the LN list and ON list
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to generate the candidates.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: 2.3 Segmentation standards adaptor
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail numbered-heading2

column2: In this bakeoff, there are four segmentation
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: standards and slightly different from ours. Stan-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: dard adaptation is conducted with the applica-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion of an ordered list of transformations on the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: output of our segmentation system. The method
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: we use is Transformation-Based Learning, and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the transformation templates are lexicalized
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: templates. In our system, we designed 14 lexi-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: calized templates.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: 2.4 Speed
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail numbered-heading2

column2: As we optimized our lexicon and decoding
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: process, the speed of segmentation is very fast.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: On a single 2.80 GHz, 1G bytes memory, Xeon
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital column-bottom

column2: machine, the system is able to process about
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column2: 0.73 Mega bytes per second.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail numbered-heading2 tailchar-period

column2: The speed may vary according to the sen-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tence lengths: given texts of the same size, those
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: containing longer sentences will take more time.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The number reported here is an average of the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: time taken to process the test sets of the eight
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tracks we participated in.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3 Evaluation
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3.1 Open tracks
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent aligned-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2

column2: In the open tracks, we used four lexicons of
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: 210,319 entries, 165,103 entries, 174,268 entries,
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-over aligned-line tailchar-comma

column2: 165,655 entries respectively on AS-open, HK-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line tailchar-hiphen

column2: open, MSR-open, PK-open tracks, which in-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: clude the entries of 2,430 MDWs, 12,487 PNs,
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma
page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line tailchar-hiphen

column2: character idioms, plus the word lists generated
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: from the training data provided by the bakeoff.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We use the training data provided by the bakeoff
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: for training our trigram word-based language
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: model. We also used a family name list (which
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: contains 399 entries in our system), and a 1,021-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: entry transliterated name character list.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: 3.2 Closed tracks
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail numbered-heading2

column2: In the close tracks, the lexicon we use could
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: only be generated from the training data pro-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: vided by the bakeoff. We could only use the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: training data provided by the bakeoff for train-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing our word-based language model. Also, since
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the training data we used is only from the bake-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: off, there does not exist any different standards,
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: standards adaptor component is not necessarily
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: needed.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: 3.3 Result analysis
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail numbered-heading2

column2: Our system is designed so that components such
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: as the factoid detection and NE identification
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: can be switched on or off, so that we can inves-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tigate the relative contribution of each compo-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: nent to the overall word segmentation
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: performance. The results are summarized in the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: only the lexicon is used. Each cell in the table
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: has six fields. From the top, there are respec-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tively Precision, Recall, F-measure, OOV Recall,
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: IV Recall and Speed (Mega bytes/second). We
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: From Table 1 we can find that, in rows 1 and 2,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified column-top headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: the dictionary-based methods already achieve
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: quite good recall, but the precisions are not very
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: good because they cannot correctly identify un-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: known words that are not in the lexicon such as
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: factoids and name entities. We also find that
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: even using the same lexicon, our approach that
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: is based on the N-gram language models outper-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: forms the greedy approach because the use of
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: context model resolves more ambiguities in
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: segmentation. As shown in Rows 3 to 5, when
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: components are switched on in turn, the overall
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: word segmentation performance increases con-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen column-bottom

column2: sistently. The morphological analysis has no
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column2: contribution to the overall performance in Row
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: 4. The main reason is that the number of MDWs
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization

column2: used in our system is very small (only 2,430)
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and there may exist very small MDWs in the test
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sets. The similar cases occur on NE identifica-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion in the close tracks in Row 5 since we would
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: not do NE identification at all in the close tracks.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We also notice that the contribution of NE iden-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tification is very little in the open tracks, which
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: shows that the performance of NE identification
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: is not very good in our system, and explains
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: why our OOV recall is not very high compared
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen column-bottom

column2: sults of standards adaptation on four bakeoff test Julia Hockenmaier, Chris Brew. 1998. Error driven
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column full-justified font-largest column-top line-space year headchar-lower column-bottom

column2: sets are shown in Row 6. It turns out that per-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: formance except IV recall improves slightly
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The evaluation results show that the closed tests
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: is not very good compared with other partici-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: pants, the one main reason is that the word-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: based language model we used is not competi-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tive compared with other algorithms in the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: closed tracks. One area of our future work is to
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: chine (SVM), Conditional Random Field (CRF),
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: etc.
